intro: Astragalus maowensis, commonly known as the Maowen milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is typically found in mountainous regions and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Astragalus maowensis is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Chinese medicine. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a contributor to soil stabilization and biodiversity in its native habitat.
